content:
The chunk describes how to enable M_multisample transparency mode in Panda3D, which avoids depth-sorting issues but requires high-end graphics hardware. It explains that this can be done by adding the keyword "ms" via egg- palettize or manually editing egg files for specific textures.

Context: Enabling M_multisample Transparency Mode in Panda3D
To enable M_multisample transparency mode, which bypasses depth-sorting issues but necessitates high-end graphics cards, users can use egg- palettize to add the "ms" keyword or manually insert "<Scalar> alpha { ms }" into texture references.

If you use egg-palettize, you can engage M_multisample mode by putting the keyword "ms" on the line with the texture(s). Without egg-palettize, hand-edit the egg files to put the line:

<Scalar> alpha { ms }

within the <Texture> reference for the textures in question.
